page.title: 17WEST END FARM (1)
page.content: West End Farm in Merton was purchased in 1965 by Mr R. Baker.It is the only working farm now situated within the village itself.Originally 326 acres in size,it has increased to 500 acres with the acquisition of nearby land.The soil is partly clay loam and partly a lighter type over stone brash.The farm employs Mr Baker,two of his sons and another workman.West End Farm is typical of many of the local arable, highly mechanised farms of the area.The crops grown include winter wheat and barley,spring wheat sown in mid march, potatoes and some oil seed rape.Many hedgerows have been removed to make field sizes bigger in order to accommodate the large machines that work the land.Much of the land lies on the flood plain of the River Ray.The Thames Valley Water Authority is liable for the upkeep of the drainage ditches
